args.natural_language_statement: Let X be a topological space and let ~ be an equivalence relation on X with quotient map q : X → X/~. Show that any continuous map h : X/~ → Y induces a continuous map h ∘ q : X → Y. Conversely, show that a continuous map f : X → Y arises in this way (i.e., f = h ∘ q for a unique continuous h) iff f is constant on equivalence classes: f(x1) = f(x2) whenever x1 ~ x2.

retrieved_examples.nl: If f : X → Y is continuous and g : Y → Z is continuous then g ∘ f is continuous.
retrieved_examples.lean:
variable {X Y Z : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X] [TopologicalSpace Y] [TopologicalSpace Z]

theorem continuous_comp {f : X → Y} {g : Y → Z} (hf : Continuous f) (hg : Continuous g) : Continuous (g ∘ f) :=
  hg.comp hf := by sorry

retrieved_examples.nl: Quotient map q : X → X/~ is continuous and universal property: Continuous maps from X/~ correspond to continuous maps f : X → Y constant on equivalence classes.
retrieved_examples.lean:
variable {X Y : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X] [TopologicalSpace Y]

variable (r : X → X → Prop) [is_equivalence r]

/-- If h : quotient r → Y is continuous then h ∘ quotient.mk r is continuous. -/
theorem quotient_comp_continuous {h : Quotient r → Y} (hh : Continuous h) : Continuous (h ∘ (Quotient.mk r)) :=
  hh.comp continuous_quotient_mk := by sorry

/-- A map f : X → Y factors through the quotient iff it is constant on equivalence classes. -/
theorem factor_through_quotient_iff {f : X → Y} : (∃! (h : Quotient r → Y), Continuous h ∧ f = h ∘ (Quotient.mk r)) ↔ (∀ x y, r x y → f x = f y) :=
  by sorry

/-- If h : Quotient r → Y is continuous then h ∘ quotient.mk r is continuous. -/

args.content:
import Mathlib

/-- Let q : X → X/∼ be the quotient map for an equivalence relation ∼ on a topological space X. A map h : X/∼ → Y is continuous iff h ∘ q : X → Y is continuous. Conversely, a continuous map F : X → Y descends to a continuous map X/∼ → Y iff F(x1) = F(x2) whenever x1 ∼ x2. -/

variable {X Y : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X] [TopologicalSpace Y]

variable {r : X → X → Prop}

variable {q : X → Quotient r} -- we take q to be the quotient map (Quotient.mk)

/-- A map h : Quotient r → Y is continuous iff h ∘ q is continuous. -/
theorem continuous_quotient_lift {h : Quotient r → Y} :
  Continuous h ↔ Continuous (h ∘ q) := by sorry

/-- A continuous map F : X → Y descends to a continuous map on the quotient iff it is constant on equivalence classes. -/
theorem continuous_descends_iff {F : X → Y} (hF : Continuous F) :
  (∃ (g : Quotient r → Y), Continuous g ∧ g ∘ q = F) ↔ (∀ x₁ x₂, r x₁ x₂ → F x₁ = F x₂) := by sorry

import Mathlib

variable {X Y : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X] [TopologicalSpace Y]

variable (s : Setoid X)

/-- If h : Quotient s → Y is continuous then h ∘ quotient.mk s is continuous. -/
theorem quotient_comp_continuous {h : Quotient s → Y} (hh : Continuous h) : Continuous (h ∘ Quotient.mk s) := by sorry

/-- A map f : X → Y factors through the quotient iff it is constant on equivalence classes. -/
theorem factor_through_quotient_iff {f : X → Y} : (∃! (h : Quotient s → Y), Continuous h ∧ f = h ∘ Quotient.mk s) ↔ (∀ x y, (Setoid.R s) x y → f x = f y) := by sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

variable {X Y : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X] [TopologicalSpace Y]

variable (s : Setoid X)

/-- If h : Quotient s → Y is continuous then h ∘ quotient.mk s is continuous. -/
theorem quotient_comp_continuous {h : Quotient s → Y} (hh : Continuous h) : Continuous (h ∘ Quotient.mk s) := by
  -- composition of continuous maps
  exact hh.comp (continuous_quotient_mk s)

/-- A map f : X → Y factors through the quotient iff it is constant on equivalence classes. -/
theorem factor_through_quotient_iff {f : X → Y} : (∃! (h : Quotient s → Y), Continuous h ∧ f = h ∘ Quotient.mk s) ↔ (∀ x y, Setoid.r (s := s) x y → f x = f y) := by sorry

import Mathlib

variable {X Y : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X] [TopologicalSpace Y]

variable [s : Setoid X]

/-- If h : Quotient s → Y is continuous then h ∘ Quotient.mk s is continuous. -/
theorem quotient_comp_continuous {h : Quotient s → Y} (hh : Continuous h) : Continuous (h ∘ Quotient.mk s) := by sorry

/-- A map f : X → Y factors through the quotient iff it is constant on equivalence classes. -/
theorem factor_through_quotient_iff {f : X → Y} : (∃! (h : Quotient s → Y), Continuous h ∧ f = h ∘ Quotient.mk s) ↔ (∀ x y, Setoid.r (x := X) x y → f x = f y) := by sorry

import Mathlib

variable {X Y : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X] [TopologicalSpace Y]

variable [s : Setoid X]

/-- If h : Quotient s → Y is continuous then h ∘ Quotient.mk s is continuous. -/
theorem quotient_comp_continuous {h : Quotient s → Y} (hh : Continuous h) : Continuous (h ∘ Quotient.mk s) := by sorry

/-- A map f : X → Y factors through the quotient iff it is constant on equivalence classes. -/
theorem factor_through_quotient_iff {f : X → Y} : (∃! (h : Quotient s → Y), Continuous h ∧ f = h ∘ Quotient.mk s) ↔ (∀ x y, Setoid.r (self := s) x y → f x = f y) := by sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

/-- Let q : X -> X/~ be the quotient map for an equivalence relation ~ on a topological space X.
A map h : X/~ -> Y is continuous iff h ∘ q is continuous. Conversely, a continuous map F : X -> Y
descends to a continuous map X/~ -> Y iff F(x1) = F(x2) whenever x1 ~ x2. -/

variable {X Y : Type*}
variable (s : Setoid X)
variable [tX : TopologicalSpace X] [tQ : TopologicalSpace (Quotient s)] [tY : TopologicalSpace Y]
variable (hq : tQ = TopologicalSpace.coinduced (Quotient.mk s) tX)

/-- A map h : Quotient s -> Y is continuous iff h ∘ Quotient.mk s is continuous (for the quotient topology). -/
theorem continuous_quotient_lift {h : Quotient s → Y} :
  Continuous h ↔ Continuous (h ∘ Quotient.mk s) := by sorry

/-- A continuous map F : X -> Y descends to a continuous map on the quotient iff it is constant on equivalence classes. -/
theorem continuous_descends_iff {F : X → Y} (hF : Continuous F) :
  (∃ (g : Quotient s → Y), Continuous g ∧ g ∘ Quotient.mk s = F) ↔ (∀ x₁ x₂, Setoid.r s x₁ x₂ → F x₁ = F x₂) := by sorry

import Mathlib

/-- Let q : X → X/∼ be the quotient map for an equivalence relation ∼ on a topological space X.
A map h : X/∼ → Y is continuous iff h ∘ q is continuous. Conversely, a continuous map F : X → Y
descends to a continuous map X/∼ → Y iff F(x1) = F(x2) whenever x1 ∼ x2. -/

theorem continuous_quotient_lift {X Y : Type*} (s : Setoid X)
  (tX : TopologicalSpace X) (tQ : TopologicalSpace (Quotient s))
  (ht : tQ = TopologicalSpace.coinduced (Quotient.mk s) tX)
  (tY : TopologicalSpace Y) {h : Quotient s → Y} :
  @Continuous (Quotient s) Y tQ tY h ↔ @Continuous X Y tX tY (h ∘ Quotient.mk s) := by sorry

/-- A continuous map F : X → Y descends to a continuous map on the quotient iff it is constant on equivalence classes. -/
theorem continuous_descends_iff {X Y : Type*} (s : Setoid X)
  (tX : TopologicalSpace X) (tQ : TopologicalSpace (Quotient s))
  (ht : tQ = TopologicalSpace.coinduced (Quotient.mk s) tX)
  (tY : TopologicalSpace Y) {F : X → Y} (hF : @Continuous X Y tX tY F) :
  (∃ (g : Quotient s → Y), @Continuous (Quotient s) Y tQ tY g ∧ g ∘ Quotient.mk s = F) ↔
    (∀ x₁ x₂, Setoid.r s x₁ x₂ → F x₁ = F x₂) := by sorry

import Mathlib

/-- Let q : X → X/∼ be the quotient map for an equivalence relation ∼ on a topological space X.
A map h : X/∼ → Y is continuous iff h ∘ q is continuous. Conversely, a continuous map F : X → Y
descends to a continuous map X/∼ → Y iff F(x1) = F(x2) whenever x1 ∼ x2. -/

variable {X Y : Type*}
variable (s : Setoid X)
variable (tX : TopologicalSpace X) (tQ : TopologicalSpace (Quotient s)) (tY : TopologicalSpace Y)
variable (ht : tQ = TopologicalSpace.coinduced (Quotient.mk s) tX)

/-- A map h : Quotient s → Y is continuous iff h ∘ Quotient.mk s is continuous (for the quotient topology). -/
theorem continuous_quotient_lift {h : Quotient s → Y} :
  @Continuous (Quotient s) Y tQ tY h ↔ @Continuous X Y tX tY (h ∘ Quotient.mk s) := by sorry

/-- A continuous map F : X → Y descends to a continuous map on the quotient iff it is constant on equivalence classes. -/
theorem continuous_descends_iff {F : X → Y} (hF : @Continuous X Y tX tY F) :
  (∃ (g : Quotient s → Y), @Continuous (Quotient s) Y tQ tY g ∧ g ∘ Quotient.mk s = F) ↔
    (∀ x₁ x₂, @Setoid.r X s x₁ x₂ → F x₁ = F x₂) := by sorry

import Mathlib

/-- Let q : X → X/∼ be the quotient map for an equivalence relation ∼ on a topological space X.
A map h : X/∼ → Y is continuous iff h ∘ q is continuous. Conversely, a continuous map F : X → Y
descends to a continuous map X/∼ → Y iff F(x1) = F(x2) whenever x1 ∼ x2. -/

theorem continuous_quotient_lift {X Y : Type*} (s : Setoid X)
  (tX : TopologicalSpace X) (tQ : TopologicalSpace (Quotient s))
  (ht : tQ = TopologicalSpace.coinduced (Quotient.mk s) tX)
  (tY : TopologicalSpace Y) {h : Quotient s → Y} :
  @Continuous (Quotient s) Y tQ tY h ↔ @Continuous X Y tX tY (h ∘ Quotient.mk s) := by sorry

theorem continuous_descends_iff {X Y : Type*} (s : Setoid X)
  (tX : TopologicalSpace X) (tQ : TopologicalSpace (Quotient s))
  (ht : tQ = TopologicalSpace.coinduced (Quotient.mk s) tX)
  (tY : TopologicalSpace Y) {F : X → Y} (hF : @Continuous X Y tX tY F) :
  (∃ (g : Quotient s → Y), @Continuous (Quotient s) Y tQ tY g ∧ g ∘ Quotient.mk s = F) ↔
    ∀ x₁ x₂ : X, Setoid.r s x₁ x₂ → F x₁ = F x₂ := by sorry
